abstract_summ: Results and Discussion During this study 26 COVID-19 positive patients were admitted in MG Hospital, Bhilwara.Here we describe the characteristics of the first 100 laboratory confirmed COVID-19 patients admitted to the Elisabeth-Tweesteden Hospital (Tilburg, The Netherlands).General symptoms and ear–nose–throat symptoms were predominant in COVID-19 patients presenting mild-to-moderate symptoms.The main difference between male and female patients was an increased prevalence of ear–nose–throat symptoms as well as diarrhea, chest pains, and headaches in female patients.In France, health authorities recommend outpatient management of patients presenting mild-to-moderate COVID-19 symptoms.

title_abstract_phrases: Results and Discussion During this study 26 COVID-19 positive patients were admitted in MG Hospital, Bhilwara.The Netherlands].Here we describe the characteristics of the first 100 laboratory confirmed COVID-19 patients admitted to the Elisabeth-Tweesteden Hospital (Tilburg, The Netherlands).General symptoms and ear–nose–throat symptoms were predominant in COVID-19 patients presenting mild-to-moderate symptoms.Patients with older age and associated comorbid conditions (COPD and diabetes) seem to have greater risk for lung injury.[The first 100 COVID-19 patients admitted to the Elisabeth-Tweesteden Hospital, Tilburg,In France, health authorities recommend outpatient management of patients presenting mild-to-moderate COVID-19 symptoms.
